sen.j: 本来は領家より派遣されるのが一般的であったが、後には現地の事情に通じた開発領主が任命され、給田と呼ばれる所領給与とともに子孫に継承されていった。
sen.e: In the beginning, they were generally sent from ryoke, but some time later, kaihatsu-ryoshu (local notables who actually developed the land) well-informed about the local situation began to be appointed, thus it was handed down to posterity along with kyuden meaning incomes from land taxes on shoryo (territory).

sen.j: 彼らは現地の村々における責任者として荘園ならびにそこに住む百姓を監督する役目を担い、年貢・夫役などは彼らを通じて徴収された。
sen.e: As a responsible person of the village, they served as surveillance of shoen and peasants living in there, and nengu (annual tribute, land tax) and the compulsory service were provided through them.
As a responsible person of the village, they served as an overseer of shoen and peasants living in there, and nengu (annual tribute, land tax) and the compulsory service were paid through them.

sen.j: だが、領家・地頭・百姓間において対立が生じるとその間に挟まれて苦慮する立場でもあった。
sen.e: However, when the confrontation occurred between ryoke or jito (the leader of the group reciters) and peasants, they were put in the difficult position between them.

sen.j: なお、検注に際して国衙側の公文が持つ土地台帳と荘園側の公文が持つ台帳を勘合する際の事務経費を公文勘料（くもんかんりょう）と呼び、検注時に農民に対して臨時に賦課されて、実際の経費及び実務に当たった荘園側の公文に対する得分（報酬）として宛がわれた。
sen.e: In addition, the clerical expense at kenchu (land survey) for reconciling the cadaster owned by kumon of kokuga and that of kumon of shoen was called kumon-kanryo, which was imposed to peasants as tax at the time of kenchu, in order to cover the actual expense and the reward to kumon of shoen who actually handled the practice.

In addition, kumon kanryo, the clerical expense at kenchu (land survey) for checking the cadaster owned by kumon of kokuga against that of kumon of shoen, was imposed on peasants as extra tax at the time of kenchu, in order to cover the actual expense and the reward to kumon of shoen who actually handled the practice.
sen.cmt: 語順を変えました。reconsiling～and→checking～against としました。to→on としました。extra を追加しました。
